result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M. Belongie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: to run concurrent with the sentence defendant is presently serving in Green Bay Correctional Institution.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy M. Belongie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody appearing via zoom from Green Bay Correctional Institution.   
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 1.   Motion granted.    
Count 1 - Bail Jumping - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.   
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for thirty (30) days, to run concurrent with the sentence defendant is presently serving.   Submit DNA sample.   
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 12-31-22 or 10 days jail.   
Minutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:33 p.m.  Defendant in custody.  Defendant waived his right to counsel at initial appearance.  No inducement per the State.  Court recesses.
2:51 p.m.  Defendant, in custody, requests he proceed to hearing pro se.   Court allows defendant to proceed pro se.
After testimony and argument, court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and binds defendant over to Br. 3 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT -
Information to be filed that mirrors Complaint.
Defendant wai9ves reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  4/22/22, 8:30 A.M.
Defendant indicates he will be applying for Drug Court.
Adj. 3:07 p.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:31 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Timothy M. Belongie appeared by video, in custody.  Counsel waived.  Court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to counsel in this matter.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 12-18-21.  
Initial appearance is set for 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.
